tasks.objective: [feedback] Create metrics reader - load metrics.jsonl, parse outcomes, compute success rates by model/complexity
tasks.resolution: Implemented src/feedback-metrics.ts with loadMetrics(), analyzeMetrics(), success rate analysis by model/complexity, and insights CLI command

tasks.objective: [feedback] Wire metrics to routing - adjust complexity thresholds based on historical success rates per model tier
[feedback] Add 'undercity introspect' command - analyze own metrics, identify improvement opportunities, generate tasks
[feedback] Wire experiment framework to grind - randomly assign tasks to variants, track which routing/prompts work better
tasks.resolution: Already fully implemented and wired into grind - selectVariant, recordResult, getVariantMetrics all integrated

tasks.objective: [feedback] Learn task patterns - cluster similar tasks by objective keywords, track which patterns succeed at which tiers
[context] Build AST indexer - parse TypeScript files, extract function/class/type definitions, store in queryable format for fast lookup
[context] Build dependency graph - map imports/exports between files, identify which files are affected by changes to a given file
[context] Pre-compute file summaries - for each file, generate a 1-2 line description of purpose/exports, cache for fast context loading
tasks.resolution: Auto-generated file summaries from AST exports. Added getFileSummary(), getFileSummaries(), getAllSummaries() to index. Added --summaries CLI option. Summaries included in context briefing for agents.

tasks.objective: [context] Smart context selection - given a task, automatically identify which files/functions are relevant using AST + dependency graph
[metrics] Track success rate per complexity level - which tasks need escalation most?
tasks.resolution: Already implemented via complexity-metrics command - tracks success rate per complexity level with escalation recommendations

tasks.objective: [learning] Evaluate DSPy for prompt optimization - assess if prompt quality is the bottleneck vs routing/model selection
[continuous] Sync task board with grind - mark tasks complete when merged, update status during execution
tasks.resolution: Tasks now marked in_progress when grind starts working on them. Complete/failed status already handled.

tasks.objective: [verify] Make spell check non-blocking - spell failures should warn but not fail verification
tasks.resolution: Spell errors are non-blocking - log warning but do not fail verification (verification.ts:68-74)

tasks.objective: [onboard] Create 'undercity init' command - interactive/auto-detecting setup for new projects, creates .undercity/ structure
tasks.resolution: Init command now detects project tooling (package manager, test runner, linter, build tool) and creates profile.json with verification commands

tasks.objective: [onboard] Auto-detect project tooling - scan package.json/configs for package manager, test runner, linter, build system
tasks.resolution: Implemented as part of 'undercity init' - detects package manager, test runner, linter, build tool

tasks.objective: [onboard] Abstract verification loop - replace hardcoded 'pnpm check && pnpm build && pnpm test' with configurable project-specific commands
tasks.resolution: Verification loop now reads commands from .undercity/profile.json - typecheck, test, lint, spell, qualityCheck are all configurable

tasks.objective: [onboard] Scout-generated rules - use scout agent to analyze codebase and generate .claude/rules/ with architecture, patterns, conventions
[onboard] Create project profile system - .undercity/profile.json storing learned patterns, failure modes, optimal thresholds per project
tasks.resolution: Implemented via ProjectProfile interface and .undercity/profile.json - stores detected tooling and verification commands

tasks.objective: [onboard] Self-tuning after tasks - analyze verification failures, adjust complexity routing, update project profile automatically
[portable] Make undercity installable as npm package - 'npx undercity init' or 'pnpm add -D undercity' workflow
[agent-opt] Rewrite oracle cards for agent utility - replace poetic lore with concrete examples, action patterns, or decision heuristics that actually help agents
[agent-opt] Audit all agent prompts (squad definitions) - optimize for task completion, remove fluff, add concrete behavioral guidelines
tasks.resolution: Tightened squad prompts: fixed naming (flute→scout, logistics→planner, sheriff→reviewer), removed hardcoded pnpm commands, reduced verbosity by ~60%

tasks.objective: [periodic] Run semantic-check and fix high-priority density issues
tasks.resolution: Added --summary flag (default) for compact agent-friendly output. Removed redundant comments in mixed-handlers.ts.

tasks.objective: [optimization] Review .claude/rules files for semantic density improvements
Run semantic-check and convert flagged prose sections to markdown tables in .claude/rules/*.md files
[grind] Enhanced verification retry logic - opus tier should get 7 attempts instead of 2, progressive escalation with more retries per tier
tasks.resolution: Added maxOpusRetries option (default 7). Opus tier now gets 7 attempts before failing vs 3 for other tiers. Progressive escalation maintained.

tasks.objective: [grind] Task conflict detection - before starting task, check if similar task (>70% similarity) is already running
tasks.resolution: Added findSimilarInProgressTask() with Jaccard similarity. Orchestrator now skips tasks >70% similar to in-progress tasks.

tasks.objective: [grind] Improve agent prompts - add instruction to check git log before implementing, return TASK_ALREADY_COMPLETE if work exists
[docs] Add reconciliation to grind workflow docs - explain when to run reconcile, how confidence scoring works
[cli] Add --priority flag to 'undercity add' command for explicit task prioritization
[refactor] Refactor git.ts MergeQueue.processNext method - complexity 18, 2 nested blocks. Simplify merge processing logic
[refactor] Refactor git.ts MergeQueue.processWorktreeBranch method - complexity 17. Extract rebase and merge strategies
[refactor] Reduce primitive obsession in task.ts - 89% primitive args. Introduce typed parameter objects where appropriate
tasks.resolution: Work completed via worktree, committed to main in 6952482

tasks.objective: [cli] Add 'undercity update' command - update task objective, priority, tags, or status. Usage: undercity update <task-id> --objective '...' --priority N --tags tag1,tag2
[stabilization] Add real-time grind reporting - show what's happening now, don't wait for completion
[stabilization] Add error boundaries to grind - one task failure shouldn't crash entire grind
[stabilization] Test grind on 10 real tasks, measure success rate, document failures
[stabilization] Make verification retries configurable - currently hardcoded and confusing
[priming] Implement work hook system - write assignment.json to worktree before spawning agent. Assignment survives crashes. Agent reads assignment on startup and enters autonomous mode immediately
tasks.resolution: Implemented writeTaskAssignment in orchestrator.ts, TaskAssignment interface in types.ts

tasks.objective: [priming] Implement per-task checkpoints - write .undercity/checkpoints/{taskId}.json after each significant action. Track: lastAction, modifiedFiles, verificationStatus, attempt number. Enables granular crash recovery
tasks.resolution: Implemented saveCheckpoint in worker.ts at phases: starting, context, executing, verifying, reviewing, committing. Stores in assignment file.

tasks.objective: [priming] Create worker prompt template with propulsion directive - include task assignment, verification requirements, completion protocol, and explicit DO NOT list (no questions, no waiting, no planning before acting)
tasks.resolution: Implemented buildAssignmentContext in worker.ts - injects assignment, recovery context into agent prompt

tasks.objective: [priming] Wire checkpoint recovery to worker spawn - on crash recovery, inject checkpoint context into worker prompt showing previous progress, modified files, and resume point
tasks.resolution: resumeRecovery extracts checkpoints from worktrees before cleanup, stores in recoveredCheckpoints map, injects into new assignment

tasks.objective: [priming] Add worker identity detection from worktree path - worker knows its task ID, branch, and role from directory structure. No need to pass context explicitly
tasks.resolution: Implemented detectAssignmentFromCwd in persistence.ts, exported from index.ts

tasks.objective: [priming] Track verification status per checkpoint - record which verifications (typecheck/test/lint) passed/failed per attempt. Worker sees what already passed and focuses on failures
tasks.resolution: Checkpoints include lastVerification with passed/failed status and errors array. Shown in prompt via buildAssignmentContext.

tasks.objective: [skill] Create undercity as Claude Code skill - expose grind, add, tasks commands as skill invocations. Normal Claude Code session can spawn undercity for autonomous batch work
[skill] Implement handoff protocol - when Claude Code invokes undercity skill, pass current context (files read, decisions made) as handoff content. Undercity workers start with context, not cold
[skill] Implement results return protocol - when undercity completes tasks, return structured summary to calling Claude Code session. Include: tasks completed, files changed, any failures
tasks.resolution: Implemented grindComplete() in output.ts for structured JSON summary of grind results

tasks.objective: [witness] Add lightweight health monitoring - detect stuck workers (no checkpoint update in N minutes), log warnings before killing. Pattern from gastown witness
[witness] Implement nudge-before-kill pattern - if worker appears stuck, send context nudge before terminating. Give worker chance to recover
[integration] Add push-after-success option - optionally push to remote after successful merge. Default off, enable with --push flag or config

[recovery] Implement atomic recovery state - replace fragile recovery.json with directory structure: .undercity/active/{taskId}.state and .undercity/completed/{taskId}.done. On crash, scan active/ to resume. Atomic file ops prevent corruption
tasks.resolution: Added BatchMetadata, ActiveTaskState, CompletedTaskState types. Implemented atomic directory-based recovery in persistence.ts. Updated orchestrator to use initializeBatch(), per-task state writes, and directory scanning for recovery.

tasks.objective: [phase3] Build metrics dashboard - display token usage per model, success/failure rates by complexity, cost tracking over time. Integrate with existing live-metrics.ts
[phase3] Create capability ledger - track what task types succeed at each model tier. Use historical data to improve routing decisions. Store in .undercity/capability-ledger.json

Add a comment to the PATTERNS_FILE constant in error-fix-patterns.ts explaining it stores error-fix correlations
Implement PreToolUse hook for knowledge injection: create a hook that intercepts tool calls and injects relevant context from error-fix-patterns, task-file-patterns, and knowledge.json
Create queryable knowledge tool: expose knowledge.json as searchable MCP tool that workers can query for relevant learnings during task execution
[research] Design MCP server interface with search endpoint specifications
Implement text search and filtering logic for knowledge queries
Create MCP tool definition and request handlers for knowledge search
Write integration code to expose the search tool through MCP protocol
Create usage documentation and examples for workers querying knowledge
Test knowledge search with sample queries and edge cases
Add delta knowledge extraction: only process new learnings from sessions, not re-process entire history (inspired by Nexus delta distillation)
Add contradiction detection: surface conflicting decisions/learnings in knowledge.json (e.g. 'use X for auth' vs 'avoid X for auth')
Add vector similarity to knowledge search: embed learnings for semantic 'find related' queries beyond keyword matching
Expose knowledge via REST API: JSON endpoints for querying decisions/learnings (agent-consumable, no HTML)
Add session transcript capture hook: auto-distill grind session transcripts into knowledge.json on completion
Add identity resolution for knowledge: track who/what (human vs AI) authored each learning, enable 'what did X decide' queries
Add universal webhook endpoint for knowledge ingestion: accept JSON from GitHub PRs, Slack, Linear with AI-powered understanding
Categorize knowledge into decisions vs learnings: decisions are choices made, learnings are insights discovered (not action items)
RLM-style knowledge exploration: let agents write Python code to programmatically explore knowledge.json instead of just keyword search (treat knowledge as REPL environment object)
Recursive session distillation: for large transcripts (>10K tokens), use RLM-style chunking + recursive summarization before knowledge extraction
Context budget based on RLM findings: inject knowledge in chunks with verification sub-calls to prevent context rot degradation
Recursive knowledge synthesis: for complex queries, decompose into sub-queries, recursively gather answers, then synthesize (RLM pattern)
Progressive knowledge building: stream learnings to knowledge.json as session progresses, not just at end (RLM progressive output pattern)
Verification sub-calls for contradiction detection: use RLM-style recursive queries to verify knowledge consistency across entries
Semantic chunking for knowledge storage: partition learnings by topic/domain using RLM semantic partitioning, not just flat list
Async parallel knowledge distillation: process multiple transcript chunks simultaneously (RLM suggests async LM calls for 3x speedup)
Auto-generate 'signs for Ralph': after N failures of same type, auto-append warning to worker prompts (error-fix-patterns → prompt injection)
Prompt evolution from knowledge: inject relevant learnings/decisions into worker prompts automatically (accumulated knowledge → better Ralph)
Detect deterministic failure modes: classify recurring errors into fixable categories, generate targeted prompt patches (Ralph tuning)
Eventual consistency metrics: track convergence rate per task type, identify which tasks need more 'signs' vs model escalation
Graduate to 'New Ralph': after accumulating enough learnings for a domain, generate optimized domain-specific prompts (prompt distillation)
Recursive Ralph with knowledge: use RLM-style decomposition + Nexus knowledge injection for complex tasks (all three patterns combined)
Operator skill metrics: track which prompt patterns correlate with success, surface 'LLM mirror' insights to improve prompting
Add Witness patrol: periodic check for stuck workers, trigger recovery or escalation (Gas Town pattern)
Add workflow Formulas: TOML-defined reusable task patterns (e.g., 'release', 'refactor-module') that expand to task sequences
Add Molecules: durable chained workflows that survive crashes, track multi-step processes as linked beads
Add Seance: query previous grind sessions for context/decisions (combine with Nexus knowledge capture)
Add Boot the Dog: watchdog for the daemon watchdog, ensure daemon itself stays healthy
Add inter-worker messaging (Nudge): allow workers to signal each other for coordination without going through orchestrator
GUPP + Ralph loop: 'If there is work on your Hook, YOU MUST RUN IT' - make grind more aggressive about processing available work
NDI via knowledge: achieve Nondeterministic Idempotence by recording all decisions/learnings, replay to get consistent outcomes
Refinery with learning: AI-powered merge conflict resolution that learns from past resolutions (Gas Town Refinery + error-fix patterns)
Formulas from patterns: auto-generate workflow Formulas from frequently co-occurring task sequences in history
Seance + RLM: recursively query past sessions to build context for complex tasks (Gas Town Seance + RLM decomposition)
[vision] Federated learning network: share anonymized learnings across undercity instances (opt-in), build collective intelligence without exposing proprietary code
[vision] Predictive task generation: infer what human will want next from patterns (time-of-day, recent commits, calendar), propose before asked
[vision] Adversarial self-improvement: spawn 'red team' agent to find weaknesses in completed work, proactively harden before merge
[vision] Economic optimizer: track cost-per-value (tokens spent vs impact delivered), auto-adjust routing to maximize ROI not just success rate
[vision] Emergent specialization: let workers naturally specialize based on success patterns, create 'expert' prompt variants per domain
[vision] Self-modifying orchestration: orchestrator evolves its own strategies (retry logic, routing, decomposition) based on meta-metrics
[vision] Temporal scheduling intelligence: learn when tasks succeed best (time of day, after which commits, sprint phase), auto-schedule for optimal timing
[vision] Counterfactual reasoning: 'what if we had chosen X?' - simulate alternate decisions using knowledge graph, inform future choices
[vision] Code archaeology agent: analyze git history + decisions to understand WHY code evolved, inject 'institutional memory' into context
[vision] Autonomous codebase gardening: proactively identify and fix tech debt, refactoring opportunities, security issues without being asked
[vision] Intent completion: from partial/ambiguous instructions, predict full intent using past decisions + codebase patterns, confirm with human
[vision] Meta-orchestration layer: orchestrate multiple undercity instances across repos, share context, coordinate cross-repo changes
[vision] Dream mode: during idle time, agents 'dream' - replay past sessions, discover patterns, consolidate learnings, wake up smarter
[vision] Skill acquisition: detect unknown frameworks/tools in tasks, spawn research agent to learn them, add to capability set without retraining
